samples.context: Sieve elements are the conducting elements of the phloem. Sieve elements are of two types – sieve cells and sieve tubes. Sieve cells are present in Pteridophytes and Gymnosperms whereas sieve tubes are present in Angiosperms.
samples.question: What are the two types of sieve elements?

samples.context: Sieve elements are the conducting elements of the phloem. Sieve elements are of two types – sieve cells and sieve tubes. Sieve cells are present in Pteridophytes and Gymnosperms whereas sieve tubes are present in Angiosperms.
samples.question: In which plants are sieve tubes found?

samples.context: Sieve elements are the conducting elements of the phloem. Sieve elements are of two types – sieve cells and sieve tubes. Sieve cells are present in Pteridophytes and Gymnosperms whereas sieve tubes are present in Angiosperms.
samples.question: Which type of sieve element is found in Gymnosperms?

samples.context: Sieve elements are the conducting elements of the phloem. Sieve elements are of two types – sieve cells and sieve tubes. Sieve cells are present in Pteridophytes and Gymnosperms whereas sieve tubes are present in Angiosperms.
samples.question: What is the primary function of sieve elements?
